name: Xiaomi Redmi 5 (64GB)
description: Boasting a big 5.7-inch HD+ display, Xiaomi Redmi 5 64GB is ergonomically built. The smartphone ships with a wider 18:9 display and is powered by an octa-core Snapdragon 450 processor and 4GB RAM. For storing apps and data, there is 64GB of expandable onboard storage space. Equipped with a 12MP rear and a 5MP front-facing shooter, the handset also features a fingerprint scanner. The smartphone is backed by a 3,300mAh battery and ships with a metal unibody design. The next versions of the Redmi 5 are the Redmi 6 and the Redmi 7.

name: Xiaomi Redmi Note 6 Pro
description: The Xiaomi Redmi Note 6 Pro is the successor to the Redmi Note 5 Pro. The smartphone comes with a 6.26-inch display. The display has Full HD+ resolution, Gorilla Glass protection, and bezel-less design with a notch. The device has a Qualcomm Snapdragon 636 processor. The Redmi Note 6 Pro comes in two RAM variants. The base variant has 4GB of RAM, while the other variant has 6GB of RAM. Both of them have 64GB of storage.

name: Xiaomi Redmi Note 5 64GB
description: Xiaomi released the Redmi Note 5 in February 2018. The smartphone features a 5.9-inch Full HD+ IPS display with an 18:9 aspect ratio. The next version of this smartphone is the Redmi Note 5 Pro. This is the 64GB variant, and Xiaomi also offers a 32GB model. The phone uses a 2.0GHz octa-core Snapdragon 625 SoC paired with 4GB of RAM. The other variant of this smartphone is the Redmi Note 5 32GB. The device is powered by a 4,000mAh battery under the hood while running the Android 7.1.2 Nougat based MIUI 9 operating system. It is a dual-SIM capable device which uses a hybrid SIM slot that can utilise up to 128 GB of expandable storage using a microSD card. The rear camera is a 12MP shooter with dual-LED flash, while the front has a 5MP camera.

name: Xiaomi Redmi Note 8 Pro 128GB
description: Xiaomi Redmi Note 8 Pro 128GB Price starts at Rs. 15,999. The lowest price of Xiaomi Redmi Note 8 Pro 128GB is at Amazon, which is 3% less than the cost of Redmi Note 8 Pro 128GB at Flipkart (Rs. 16459). This phone is available in 64 GB, 128 GB, 128 GB storage variants. Xiaomi Redmi Note 8 Pro 128GB is available in Gamma Green, Shadow Black, Electric Blue, White, Blue, Black, Green, Halo White colours across various online stores in India.

name: Xiaomi Redmi 7A
description: The Redmi 7A is an entry-level handset from Xiaomi that will be positioned below the company’s existing Redmi 7 lineup. The Redmi 7A succeeds its predecessor from 2018, the Redmi 6A which was well received by budget-conscious consumers in several countries. The Redmi 7A features a 5.45-inch HD+ IPS LCD display and comes powered by a competent, Snapdragon 439 processor as well making it a very good handset for the first time smartphone buyer on a tight budget. There's 2GB RAM, 16GB storage, and a dedicated microSD card slot. It also gets a set of good cameras (12MP Sony IMX486 on the rear, 5MP on the front) making for a nice phone to start your mobile photography journey. It is powered by a 4000mAh battery and features a microUSB port as well as a 3.5mm headphone jack. The latest Xiaomi smartphone you may want to watch out for is the Redmi 8A.

name: Xiaomi Mi A3
description: The Mi A3 from Xiaomi is the newest addition to the brand’s lineup of Android One handsets. It is also a significant upgrade over its predecessor, with the first major change being with its 6-inch AMOLED screen that houses an in-display fingerprint scanner and gets Gorilla Glass 5 protection. Sadly, the display resolution had to go down to 1560 x 720 to keep the phone’s price in check. Powering this smartphone is a Qualcomm Snapdragon 665 SoC that has been paired with 4GB of LPDDR4x RAM and 64GB of UFS 2.1 flash storage. For software, the Mi A3 comes loaded with near-stock Android 9 Pie OS.

name: Xiaomi Redmi Note 8 32GB
description: Xiaomi Redmi Note 8 32GB Price starts at Rs. 10,938. The lowest price of Xiaomi Redmi Note 8 32GB is at Flipkart, which is 8% less than the cost of Redmi Note 8 32GB at Amazon (Rs. 11895). This phone is available in 32 GB, 64 GB, 128 GB storage variants. Xiaomi Redmi Note 8 32GB is available in White, Black, Blue, Moonlight White colours across various online stores in India.

name: Xiaomi Redmi Y2
description: The Xiaomi Redmi Y2  is a budget offering from the Chinese manufacturer that boasts a 5.99-inch HD+ display. Out of the box, the phone comes loaded with Android Oreo OS with an EMUi skin on top. The smartphone is powered by a Snapdragon 625 chipset and 3GB RAM. It offers 32GB of storage which can be further expanded via a microSD card. This entry-level phone does feature a fingerprint sensor. The device is armed with a 16MP front and a 12+5MP dual rear camera. It is backed up by a 3,080mAh battery. The other Xiaomi mobile phones you may be interested in are the Redmi Y3, Redmi K20, and the Redmi K20 Pro.

name: Xiaomi Redmi 6 Pro
description: Redmi 6 Pro is powered by a 2GHz octa-core Snapdragon 625 chipset and 3GB of RAM. The device runs on Android 8.1 Oreo with the MIUI 9.6 skin over it. For imaging, the handset is armed with dual 12+5MP rear and a 5MP front-facing shooter. Exceptional battery backup can be had thanks to its massive 4,000mAh battery. Boasting a 5.84-inch Full HD+ display, the device has 32GB of expandable internal storage space. There is support for VoLTE along with two SIM slots. The other Xiaomi mobile phones you may be interested in are the Redmi 7 Pro, Redmi K20, and the Redmi K20 Pro.

name: Xiaomi Redmi K20
description: The Xiaomi Redmi K20 is a mid-range smartphone. It is a slightly upgraded Redmi phone aimed at the consumers who won’t mind spending more than the conventional Redmi budget phone. With its high-end specs, the Redmi K20 occupies one of the top spots in Redmi’s portfolio. The phone is stacked with flagship-level features such as an in-display fingerprint sensor, AMOLED display, pop-up selfie camera, DC Dimming support, and more.

name: null
description: null

name: Xiaomi Redmi 6
description: Xiaomi 's Redmi 6 is a budget offering from the Chinese phone maker that made its way to the Indian market in September of 2018. The smartphone is based on Android Oreo operating system. It is powered by an octa-core MediaTek Helio P22 processor, which is paired with 3GB of RAM. It is fuelled by a non-removable 3,000mAh battery. It has a fingerprint reader and ships with 32GB of internal storage space. The smartphone has a 5.45-inch HD+ display and comes with dual 12+5MP rear and a 5MP front-facing shooter. The latest Xiaomi mobile phones you may be interested in are the Redmi Note 7 pro, Redmi 7 and the Redmi Go.

name: Xiaomi Redmi Y3
description: The Redmi Y3 is a budget smartphone from Xiaomi. The phone offers a 6.26-inch HD+ IPS screen with a waterdrop notch. It is powered by Qualcomm's Snapdragon 660 chip coupled with 3 GB of RAM. The device comes with 32 GB internal storage that can be expanded via microSD card slot. The phone has a 12 MP + 2 MP dual camera at the back. To please the selfie aficionados, the handset comes equipped with a 32 MP front snapper. The Xiaomi Redmi Y3 runs Android 9.0 Pie with MIUI 10 on top. The upcoming Redmi mobile phones you may want to watch out for are the Redmi K20, Redmi K20 Pro, and the Redmi X

name: Xiaomi Redmi 8A
description: The Redmi 8A is the latest entry-level smartphone from Xiaomi. It mostly improves upon its predecessor the Redmi 7A. The phone features a 6.2-inch LCD screen with a waterdrop notch. The panel has HD+ resolution. The device is powered by Snapdragon 439 chipset and has 2 GB of RAM along with 32 GB internal storage. In the photography department, you get a 12 MP camera. There's a 8 MP module for selfies. The dual SIM phone supports 4G and has a dedicated microSD card slot. The handset draws power from a large 5,000 mAh battery. On the software side of things, the Redmi 8A runs Android 9 with Xiaomi's MIUI 10 on top. Some of the other popular Xiaomi smartphones include the Redmi 8 and the Redmi Note 8 Pro.

name: Xiaomi Redmi Go
description: The Redmi Go is the first smartphone from Xiaomi that boots Android Go operating system. It is an entry-level offering from the brand to cater to the needs of users who are not too concerned about powerful specifications and want a decent phone with an ultra-affordable price tag. The Xiaomi Redmi Go packs a 5-inch HD screen bearing 720p resolution and 16:9 aspect ratio. It conforms to a conventional design with bezels. The phone is powered by a 1.4GHz quad-core Snapdragon SoC with 1GB of RAM and 8GB of internal storage, which can be further expanded up to 128GB via microSD card. The Redmi Go comes with an 8MP rear camera with LED flash and a 5MP selfie shooter on the front.

name: Xiaomi Redmi Note 8 128GB
description: Xiaomi Redmi Note 8 128GB Price starts at Rs. 12,999. The lowest price of Xiaomi Redmi Note 8 128GB is at Amazon, which is 3% less than the cost of Redmi Note 8 128GB at Flipkart (Rs. 13434). This phone is available in 32 GB, 64 GB, 128 GB storage variants. Xiaomi Redmi Note 8 128GB is available in Neptune Blue, Cosmic Purple, Moonlight White, Space Black, Blue, Black, White, Purple colours across various online stores in India.

name: Xiaomi Redmi K20 Pro
description: The Redmi K20 Pro is yet another ‘flagship killer’ by Xiaomi. Aimed at mid-range buyers who want something premium without causing a hole in their pockets, the K20 Pro packs more than enough dynamism. The phone has a 6.39-inch AMOLED full-HD+ display bearing 1080×2340 pixels resolution and an aspect ratio of 19.5:9 alongside support for HDR and Corning Gorilla Glass 5 protection. Under the hood, Qualcomm’s top-end Snapdragon 855 SoC powers the smartphone with 6GB of LPDDR4x RAM and 128GB of UFS2.1 internal storage. The phone also boasts an optical in-display fingerprint sensor.

name: Xiaomi Redmi Note 4
description: The Xiaomi Redmi Note 4 ships with a fingerprint reader at the back and runs Android 6.0 Marshmallow out of the box. The device is paired with a 13MP autofocus rear camera and a 5MP front shooter that can shoot Full HD videos. The big 4,100mAh battery can last longer than expected and the device is bundled with all the common options in terms of connectivity like 4G, Bluetooth 4.1, Infrared, and a microUSB 2.0 port. There is 32GB of onboard storage space which via the Hybrid SIM slot can be expanded up to 256GB. The latest popular budget smartphone you may also like is Redmi Note 7. The next variant of this mobile is Redmi Note 5. If you are a gameaholic and wanted to play them on a Xiaomi phone, then buy Black Shark 2.

name: Xiaomi Mi Max 3
description: The Xiaomi Mi Max 3 has a 6.9-inch display with Full HD+ resolution, 18:9 aspect ratio, and a nearly bezel-less design. The smartphone is powered by Qualcomm Snapdragon 636 processor, and it runs on Android 8.1 Oreo OS customized with MIUI 10. The device comes in two variants; 4GB RAM + 64GB storage and 6GB RAM + 128GB storage. There is a dual-camera setup at the rear, which has a 12MP main camera and a 5MP depth-sensing camera. The rear camera setup can also record 4K videos. There is an 8MP front-facing camera. The USP of the Mi Max series devices is their large battery, and the Mi Max 3 is no different; it has a 5500mAh battery that supports Qualcomm Quick Charge 3.0 fast charging. The other Xiaomi mobile phones you may be interested in are Xiaomi Mi CC9, Mi CC9e, and the Mi MIX 4

name: Xiaomi Mi 8
description: The Xiaomi Mi 8 has a 6.2-inch Super AMOLED screen with Full HD+ resolution, notch, and HDR10. There's a 12MP+12MP dual-camera with 4K video recording and a 20MP selfie camera. The Mi 8 uses a Snapdragon 845 processor, up to 8GB RAM and up to 256GB storage. The phone has a fingerprint reader as well as IR face unlock. It's a dual-SIM phone with latest connectivity features and a USB Type-C port. The phone is powered by a 3400mAh battery with Quick Charge 4.0+. The Mi 8 SE is a good choice for those looking at a cheaper option. The latest Xiaomi mobile phones you may be interested in are the Redmi Note 8 and the Redmi 8.

name: Xiaomi Redmi Note 7
description: The Xiaomi Redmi Note 7 has a 6.3-inch IPS LCD screen with Full HD+ resolution and Corning Gorilla Glass 5 protection. The display has a nearly bezel-less design and a waterdrop notch in it. The device features the Qualcomm Snapdragon 660 octa-core chipset and Android 9 Pie operating system with MIUI 10 customization. There are two variants on offer; 3GB RAM + 32GB storage, 4GB RAM + 64GB storage. With microSD card support, the storage on the Redmi Note 7 can be further expanded up to 256GB. The smartphone has a 12MP+2MP dual-camera setup at the back and an AI-backed 13MP selfie camera at the front that is geared with features such as Portrait mode, Smart Beauty, Scene recognition, and more. The Xiaomi Redmi Note 7 packs a 4000mAh battery with support for Quick Charge 4.0 fast charging. There is USB Type-C port, a 3.5mm audio jack, dual-SIM connectivity, 4G LTE, Bluetooth v5.0, and dual-band Wi-Fi ac for connectivity. Other features include a rear-mounted fingerprint scanner.

name: Xiaomi Redmi 7
description: The Xiaomi Redmi 7 is yet another budget offering from the brand. It comes with a 6.26-inch HD+ display with 720×1520 pixels resolution bearing a 19:9 aspect ratio and Corning Gorilla Glass 5 protection. It also boasts a P2i splash-resistant coating. An octa-core Snapdragon 632 SoC clocked at 1.8GHz powers the device with 2GB/3GB/4GB of RAM and 16GB/32GB/64GB of internal storage, depending on the variant. A 12MP+2MP dual rear camera setup handles the imaging segment alongside an 8MP front camera. Connectivity options supported by the Redmi 7 include dual-SIM, 4G VoLTE, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth v4.2, GPS/ A-GPS, USB, a 3.5mm headphone jack, and an Infrared (IR) blaster. A 4,000mAh battery completes the Redmi 7.
